info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Mesa and south central Garfield Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 530 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms over Parachute, or 35 miles northeast of Grand Junction, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Mesa and south central Garfield Counties, including the following locations... Mesa, Battlement Mesa and Molina. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 52 and 53, and between mile markers 55 and 85. Colorado 65 between mile markers 50 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
